intro: Dunantia microcephala, commonly known as the small-headed dunantia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically features lance-shaped leaves and produces vibrant, tubular flowers in shades of red, orange, or yellow. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
